definition: suffix of a noun of locality
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The development of dark tourism from edge to typical in practice.
sentences.chinese: 黑色旅游“在实践中正从边缘化向典型化发展。

sentences.english: It blights lives in terms of poverty and marginalization.
sentences.chinese: 从贫困和边缘化的角度来看，它使生活变得恶劣。

sentences.english: We're the only ones who can marginalise racist attackers.
sentences.chinese: 我们是唯一能让种族歧视边缘化的人。

sentences.english: This marginalization of those in social housing estates requires a different public housing system.
sentences.chinese: 这在社会住房的边缘化屋需要不同的公共房屋系统。

sentences.english: Mother language instruction is a powerful way to fight discrimination and reach out to marginalised populations.
sentences.chinese: 母语教学是消除歧视和帮助边缘化人群的有效工具。

sentences.english: So can Sudan's marginalized peripheries unite against Khartoum?
sentences.chinese: 因此可以团结起来，反对喀土穆苏丹的边缘化边缘？

sentences.english: The continuing turnover in prime ministers and cabinets has further marginalized Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 日本首相及内阁的持续妥协也让日本更一步的边缘化。

sentences.english: But these believers are colluding in their own marginalization.
sentences.chinese: 但这些信徒只是在他们自己边缘化了的圈子里密谋。

sentences.english: Alternative economic theorists are thrown Nobels and quickly marginalized.
sentences.chinese: 替代的经济理论家被诺贝尔奖排斥并很快边缘化。

sentences.english: More or less traditional textile process back in the marginalized status of the time.
sentences.chinese: 中国传统纺织工艺或多或少地在退于边缘化地位之时。

sentences.english: The same kind of transformation can happen with marginalized people.
sentences.chinese: 同样的转变也会在这些被边缘化的人们身上发生。
关键人群继续被边缘化。

sentences.english: Poverty is both a cause and consequence of marginalization and social exclusion.
sentences.chinese: 贫穷既是边缘化和社会排斥的原因，也是其后果。

sentences.english: This collection of poems also displays the poet's writing trend from edge-ization to internationalization.
sentences.chinese: 诗集反映出诗人汉语写作从边缘化走向国际化的势态。

sentences.english: They, in turn, were ruthless in killing and marginalising more moderate Tamils.
sentences.chinese: 他们无情的杀戮转而使更多的温和派泰米尔人边缘化。

sentences.english: Jobs knew all about being marginalized.
sentences.chinese: 乔布斯对“被边缘化”深有体会。

definition: marginalized people (not part of mainstream society)/marginal man (term coined by social psychologist Kurt Lewin, referring to a person in transition between two cultures or social groups, not fully belonging to either)
rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
to sink down to/to be reduced to (sth inferior)
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
(literary) to decline/to wane/title of a section in the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1]
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
the last few years/last several years/recent years
